Manx: Eshyn: “Saillym dy row ny shenn laghyn feniaghtagh ayn nish, dy voddin goll magh as jannoo caggey er-nyn-son-eu.”
English: He: “I wish these were the old days of chivalry, that I might go out and do battle for you.”

Manx: Ish: “Wahll, ta’n moddey yishig ’sy garey veealloo fuirraghtyn er-nyn-son-eu nish, Vr Kodere.”
English: She: “Well, father's dog is in the front garden waiting for you now, Mr Watterson.”
